Properties

long AssetCacheMemoryUsage [get]
TimeSpan AssetRequestTimeAfterCacheMiss [get]
 This is the time it took for the last asset request made in response to a cache miss.
long AssetServiceRequestFailures [get]
 Record the number of times that an asset request has failed. Failures are effectively exceptions, such as request timeouts. If an asset service replies that a particular asset cannot be found, this is not counted as a failure.
long AssetsInCache [get]
 These statistics are being collected by push rather than pull. Pull would be simpler, but I had the notion of providing some flow statistics (which pull wouldn't give us). Though admittedly these haven't yet been implemented...
long BlockedMissingTextureRequests [get]
 Number of persistent requests for missing textures we have started blocking from clients. To some extent this is just a temporary statistic to keep this problem in view - the root cause of this lies either in a mishandling of the reply protocol, related to avatar appearance or may even originate in graphics driver bugs on clients (though this seems less likely).
long TextureCacheMemoryUsage [get]
long TexturesInCache [get]

Property Documentation

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.AssetCacheMemoryUsage [get]

Currently misleading since we can't currently subtract removed asset memory usage without a performance hit

TimeSpan OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.AssetRequestTimeAfterCacheMiss [get]

This is the time it took for the last asset request made in response to a cache miss.

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.AssetServiceRequestFailures [get]

Record the number of times that an asset request has failed. Failures are effectively exceptions, such as request timeouts. If an asset service replies that a particular asset cannot be found, this is not counted as a failure.

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.AssetsInCache [get]

These statistics are being collected by push rather than pull. Pull would be simpler, but I had the notion of providing some flow statistics (which pull wouldn't give us). Though admittedly these haven't yet been implemented...

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.BlockedMissingTextureRequests [get]

Number of persistent requests for missing textures we have started blocking from clients. To some extent this is just a temporary statistic to keep this problem in view - the root cause of this lies either in a mishandling of the reply protocol, related to avatar appearance or may even originate in graphics driver bugs on clients (though this seems less likely).

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.TextureCacheMemoryUsage [get]

Currently unused

long OpenSim.Region.CoreModules.Framework.Monitoring.Monitors.AssetMonitor.TexturesInCache [get]

Currently unused
